This provides wrapped method about LLVMModuleRef.

Imports

../raw, types, context, type, value

Types

Module = ref ModuleObj

Modules represent the top-level structure in an LLVM program. An LLVM module is effectively a translation unit or a collection of translation units merged together.

See also:

  • newModule(string, Context)
  • newModule(Module)

Procs

proc newModule(name: string; cxt: Context = nil): Module {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Create a new, empty module in a specific context.

If cxt is nil, created module consists in the global cnotext.

This is equivalent to calling newModule(name, getGlobalContext())

Wrapping:

  • moduleCreateWithName(cstring)
  • moduleCreateWithNameInContext(cstring, ContextRef)
proc clone(self: Module): Module {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Return an exact copy of the specified module.

See also:

  • newModule(string, Context)

Wrapping:

  • cloneModule(ModuleRef)
proc newModule(other: Module): Module {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Return an exact copy of the specified module.

See also:

  • newModule(string, Context)

Wrapping:

  • cloneModule(ModuleRef)
proc identifier(self: Module): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Obtain the identifier of a module.

Wrapping:

  • getModuleIdentifier(ModuleRef, ptr csize_t)
proc identifier=(self: Module; id: string) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Set the identifier of a module to a string Ident with length Len.

Wrapping:

  • setModuleIdentifier(ModuleRef, ptr csize_t)

proc dump(self: Module) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Dump a representation of a module to stderr.

Wrapping:

  • dumpModule(ModuleRef)
proc printToFile(self: Module; filename: string): bool {...}{.discardable,
    raises: [IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}

Print a representation of a module to a file. Returns false on success, true otherwise.

Wrapping:

  • printModuleToFile(ModuleRef, cstring, cstringArray)
proc `$`(self: Module): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Return a string representation of the module.

Wrapping:

  • printModuleToString(ModuleRef)
proc addFunction(self: Module; name: string; fnty: Type): Value {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Add a function to a module under a specified name.

Wrapping:

  • addFunction(Moduleref, cstring, TypeRef)

Examples:

import
  llvm

var
  `mod` = newModule("main")
  fnty = functionType(voidType(), @[])
  fn = `mod`.addFunction("test", fnty)
assert $`mod` ==
    """; ModuleID = 'main'
source_filename = "main"

declare void @test()
"""
